answers.author: Sam Anselm
answers.text:
The city I worked in previously launched a youth initiative last year with the goal of engaging young people (middle school- and high school-age) in the community.  One of the events they held was a youth summit, whereby community and business leaders had round-table discussions with the students and just simply asked them to answer questions.  They also created a survey using surveymonkey.  A similar approach might work for you.  
If you follow this link it will take you to the report they generated from the summit:  http://www.fergusoncity.com/index.aspx?NID=455

author: Bob Connelly
text:
I have the task of creating three separate surveys for our City. One for  the business community, the citizens and one for high school students. The first two are fairly simple to research but the survey of high school student is more of a challenge.
We want to learn what they think is needed to train them for jobs that will allow them to live and work in our city after high school graduation.
Can someone suggest areas of research to enable me to put together question that will collect this data?
title: Generating Questions
